title: FiveThirtyEight - Wikipedia
snippet: In July 2013, it was revealed that Silver and his FiveThirtyEight blog would depart The New York Times and join ESPN. In its announcement of its acquisition of FiveThirtyEight, ESPN reported that "Silver will serve as the editor-in-chief of the site and will build a team of journalists, editors, analysts and contributors in the coming months.

title: FiveThirtyEight joins ABC News - ABC News
snippet: Today ABC News announced it has reached an agreement in principle to acquire the renowned data journalism organization FiveThirtyEight from ESPN. With the heightened interest in political news, FiveThirtyEight’s distinctive style of data-literate ...

title: ABC News Takes Over Nate Silver’s FiveThirtyEight
snippet: ESPN will eighty-six FiveThirtyEight, the statistics-driven news-and-analysis site led by Nate Silver. But the news outlet will go back to square one at ABC News. In an unusual transfer of corporate assets, Walt Disney’s ABC News said it would ...

title: Publishers Daily: ABC News Buys 'FiveThirtyEight'
snippet: FiveThirtyEight, which covers sports, politics and science, will continue to provide data-driven sports coverage to ESPN, which just sold it to ABC. The new ownership means FiveThirtyEight will expand its political coverage under ABC News.

title: Nate Silver of FiveThirtyEight’s advice to founders | Fortune
snippet: FiveThirtyEight’s move to ESPN was considered a “peacetime acquisition,” Silver wrote in his newsletter on Saturday.
